result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin E. Sparks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain a GED or HSED during the pendency of probation term.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Defendant to maintain timely, uninterrupted payments as ordered in Waushara Co Case No. 2013FA3. Orders subject to modification in the future by further order of the Court. All payments are to be paid through the Wisconsin Support Collections Trust Fund (WISCTF), not through the Department of Corrections.

Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.   Defendant to complete a Anger Management Program together with any follow through counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent. Contact with S. Goman as named in the complaint at the discretion of the supervising agent.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes:
With Huber.
Consecutive to: any other sentence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 3:49 pm cases called. 14CF153,16cf18, & 16CM192. Defendant Dustin E. Sparks in court with attorney Jonathan Thomas Groh.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on the record.   Defendant advised of permissible punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1 & Count 2 of 14CF153 and Count 1 & Count 2 of 16CF18.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 3 & 4 of 16CF18 & 16CM192. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Attorney Groh. No statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: Count 2 of 14CF153 and Counts 1 & 2 of 16CF18: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years. Concurrent to any other sentence. Count 1 of 14CF153-SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years. Concurrent to any other sentence. CONDITIONS: Count 1 of 16CF18-90 days WCJ, consecutive to any other sentence. CONDITIONS on all counts: Timely payments of Child Support as ordered in Waushara County case 2013FA3. Anger Management and follow through, AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Complete either HSED or GED. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Contact with S. Goman at the discretion of the supervising agent. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Court finds the defendant eligible for Earned Release and Substance Abuse Program. Appeal Rights Given.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on September 6, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

16CF-18, 16CM-192 and 14CF-153 - All 3 Cases Called @ 11:46 AM: Defendant Dustin E. Sparks in court with attorney Jonathan Thomas Groh.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  16CF-18:    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing today and go forward to ARGN. Court questions defendant and accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of preliminary hearing in its entirety.  Def BOT.   INFO Filed - INFO Stated - Receipt Admitted and Reading Waived. NGP rec'd and entered.  Per Atty Groh:  Offer had been provided by the State on resolution.  ADA recites offer extended - global resolution.  State expects argued terms on SEH.  Def and counsel concur with State's recital.  Atty Groh confirms that waiver of pre-lim hrg is made to preserve offer extended.  Court affirms its acceptance of the waiver of the pre-lim hrg.  ADA argues for bond - Signature Bond in light of custodial status.  Atty Groh joins in Signature Bond request - however limited ability to maintain CSUP payments. The Court: Orders $5000 Signature Bond however will not impose a condition of CSUP payments, arrears will continue to grow.    STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 6, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum

from DA Blader, Dated 6/22/2016 Re: Adjournment of 6/28/2016 Hearings
Adjourned initial appearance on June 28, 2016 at 11:15 am.

Case Called @ 1:46 PM: Defendant Dustin E. Sparks in court, in custody, appears via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def remains in custody in Waupaca awaiting transport to Dodge Correctional.  Def states he applied for services thru his attorney in Stevens Point but has received no word yet on counsel.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel and was told he would qualify for services.  NGP entered by Court as to 16CM-192 Only.   STC/INIT as to CF's Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  STC/Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 11:15 am.
